info.title: NetSuite REST Record API
info.description: NetSuite REST Record API generated 2024-05-24 at 10:50:50 UTC for account TSTDRV1303059, user joe.klug@peregrineconnect.com with role Neuron ESB Integration.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query that is used to filter results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit used to specify the number of results on a single page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset used for selecting a specific page of results.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: The names of sublists on this record. All sublist lines will be replaced with lines specified in the request. The names are delimited by comma.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyNameValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property name validation.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyValueValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property value validation.

X-NetSuite-PropertyValidation.description: The description of a property validation failure.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal identifier.

parameters.name: expandSubResources
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to automatically expand all sublists, sublist lines, and subrecords on this record.

parameters.name: simpleEnumFormat
parameters.description: Set to true to return enumeration values in a format that only shows the internal ID value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The names of the fields and sublists on the record. Only the selected fields and sublists will be returned in the response.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

type.title: Type
type.description: A URI reference to the documentation about the problem type.

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable description of the problem type.

status.title: Status
status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the server the request originates from.

o:errorDetails.description: An array containing one or more problem types.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A detailed, human-readable description of the problem occurrence.

o:errorPath.title: Error Path
o:errorPath.description: The JSON path that indicates where the problem occurs within the request body.

o:errorUrl.title: Error URL
o:errorUrl.description: The URI of the first element in the request URL where the problem occurs.

o:errorHeader.title: Error Header
o:errorHeader.description: The name of the HTTP header where the problem occurs.

o:errorQueryParam.title: Error Query Parameter
o:errorQueryParam.description: The name of the query parameter where the problem occurs.

o:errorCode.title: Error Code
o:errorCode.description: The application-specific error code. Similar problem types are grouped together.

items.title: Items
items.description: An array field that represents a collection of elements, for example, sublist lines, multiselect items, or search results.

isInactive.title: Inactive
isInactive.description: Check this box to inactivate this account. Inactive accounts do not show in lists on transactions and records.

isSummary.title: Summary
isSummary.description: Check this box to make this account record solely for reporting purposes. Summary accounts are useful when you want to create a non-posting, inactive parent account that has active child accounts. If you do not have a OneWorld account, new summary accounts cannot have an opening balance, but you can convert an existing account with a transaction balance into a summary account. In this case, you cannot post additional transactions to the account. Summary accounts appear with their children in the chart of accounts list. You cannot merge a summary account into another account.

openingBalance.title: Opening Balance
openingBalance.description: Enter an opening balance for this account.

tranDate.title: Date
tranDate.description: Enter the date of the opening balance of this account.

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: Returns the account's external ID, if one is assigned.

description.title: Description
description.description: Enter a description for this account.

eliminate.title: Eliminate Intercompany Transactions
eliminate.description: Check this box to make this account an intercompany account. Intercompany accounts are used to record transactions between subsidiaries. You can post both intercompany transactions and non-intercompany transactions to most intercompany accounts. Intercompany Accounts Receivable and Intercompany Accounts Payable, however, can be used only for recording amounts that are candidates for eliminations. For details, see the help topic Intercompany Accounts.

inventory.title: Inventory
inventory.description: If this will be an Other Current Asset account and you want the balance of this account included in the total balance of the Inventory KPI, select the Inventory box.

revalue.title: Revalue Open Balance for Foreign Currency Transactions
revalue.description: Check this box to select this account for open balance currency revaluation.

acctNumber.title: Number
acctNumber.description: Enter the number to identify this account. The number can be alphanumeric. The maximum number of characters is 60.

curDocNum.title: Next Check Number
curDocNum.description: Enter a number to reset the default check number that appears on transactions such as checks and bill payments. By default, this field shows the highest check number in the account plus one. The number you enter in the Next Check Number field of the account record determines the number that appears in the Check Number field on transactions linked to that account.

accountSearchDisplayNameCopy.title: Name
accountSearchDisplayNameCopy.description: Returns the account number and name, as it appears in searches.

lastModifiedDate.title: Last Modified Date
lastModifiedDate.description: Returns the date on which the account record was last modified.

includeChildren.title: Include Children
includeChildren.description: Check the Include Children box to share the account with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.

accountSearchDisplayName.title: Display Name
accountSearchDisplayName.description: Returns the account number and name, as it appears in searches. The returned name is a link to the account record.

unit.title: Default Unit
unit.description: This field displays the base unit assigned to the Unit Type. The default unit cannot be changed.

displayNameWithHierarchy.title: Display Name (with hierarchy)
displayNameWithHierarchy.description: Returns the display name of the account in order of hierarchy. Accounts are returned grouped. If you have three statistical accounts, 1002 Conference Room Square Footage appears before 1003 Collaboration Space Square Footage. And that account appears before 1004 Development Staff.

reconcileWithMatching.title: Use Match Bank Data and Reconcile Account Statement Pages
reconcileWithMatching.description: Check this box if you want to use the Match Bank Data and Reconcile Account Statement pages for this account. The original reconciliation pages are no longer supported but are still available. To use the original pages, clear the box.

fullName.title: Full Name
fullName.description: Returns the name of the account, but does not include the account number.

acctName.title: Name
acctName.description: Enter up to 31 characters for an account name that will appear on all reports. If you want to use GL account numbers and do not see a Number field above the Name field, go to Setup > Accounting > Preferences > Accounting Preferences, and check the Use Account Numbers box. Save the preference, and return to this page.
